surveyText.QID1360_QuestionText:
Your response(s) suggest you have been thinking about suicide or about hurting yourself.

Thoughts about harming or killing yourself are relatively common and not that unusual in people who feel stressed or depressed.


These kinds of thoughts can vary a lot. This may have just been a brief passing thought or reflect a sense of feeling trapped, but without any intention to do anything. Many young people have these kinds of thoughts and do not act on them.


Having thoughts of suicide is nothing to be ashamed of and we encourage you to tell someone how you are feeling. There are lots of people available to listen and help you. Talk to your trusted person, call your GP, ring  111 , or the Samaritans on 116 123, or any of the other helplines below.
surveyText.QID1361_QuestionText:
Sources of help
 
If you feel at high risk to yourself or others, or if you are self-harming, please see your GP for help.
 

Contact your GP using the normal telephone number for your GP practice. If the surgery is not open, you will either be re-directed automatically to the out-of-hours GP service or you will be given another number to call. You can also phone 111 to access the NHS 111 service, which provides access to local NHS healthcare services in England, and is available 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

If you may have been thinking about your death a lot, having persistent thoughts about killing yourself, experiencing suicidal intentions and urges, or are making plans to end your life, we strongly recommend that you contact your general practitioner or family doctor RIGHT AWAY for advice and tell them how you are feeling. They are the best person to decide what help you need

If you don't think you can stay safe, please go to the nearest hospital accident and emergency room. If none of these options are available, please contact a family member or a trusted friend, so that you won't be alone right now. It’s important to seek out the company of people who can support you and who will help to keep you safe.
surveyText.QID1362_QuestionText:
Look after yourself

If you're feeling like you need to harm yourself, take steps to keep yourself safe

  • It’s important to seek out the company of people who can support you and who will help to keep you safe.
  • Try to commit to a plan of action that does not involve suicide.
  • If you have items that maybe dangerous for you at home, please consider giving them to a trusted friend, neighbour, the police or a pharmacist for safe keeping until you feel stronger.
  • Try to minimise the use of alcohol or illicit drugs, as using these substances are likely to make your recovery harder.
  • It is important to remember that these feelings and urges do pass, and when individuals feel better, they are glad that they did not act on them.
  • There are effective treatments that can help, and there is no need to struggle alone.
  • There may be reasons for hope that you have yet to consider. 
  • Sometimes the smallest reasons for living can get you through a difficult time. 
  • It can also be helpful to think about your faith, loved ones, family and pets.
surveyText.QID1363_QuestionText:
Talk to someone

If you're feeling like you want to die, it's important to tell someone. We strongly recommend contacting your GP or family doctor as the best person to decide what help you need.

In addition to your GP or if you don’t feel that you can talk to your GP, there are many useful services and useful sources of support.

Some useful helplines to talk to someone include:

  • The Samaritans offer a confidential service so you can talk about your feelings
      Call: 116 123 (available 24-7 free to call)
      Email: jo@samaritans.org (response time 24hrs)

  • Papyrus offer national support to young people up to age 35 who are feeling suicidal. Available Mon-Fri 10:00am-5:00pm & 7:00pm-10:00pm and Weekends 2:00pm-5:00pm
      Call: 0800 068 4141
      Text: 07786209697
      Email: pat@papyrus-uk.org

  • SANE offer support to anyone coping with mental illness, including concerned relatives or friends
      Call: 0845 767 8000 (Available Daily 6:00pm – 11.00pm)

  • Maytree are a registered charity supporting people in suicidal crisis
      Call: 020 7263 7070(Available 24-7)
      Email: maytree@maytree.org.uk

  • Young Minds Crisis Messenger provides crisis support across the UK
      Text:YM to 85258
      (Available 24/7 Texts are free from EE, O2, Vodafone, 3, Virgin Mobile, BT Mobile, GiffGaff, Tesco Mobile and Telecom Plus.)

  • CALM offers support to young men in the UK who are down or in a crisis
      Call: 0800 58 58 58 (Available Daily 5:00pm – midnight)

  • ChildLine offer confidential calls, emails, or online chats for anyone under 19 for support with any problem big or small.
      Call: 0800 1111(Available 24-7 free)
      You can also sign up for a childline account on the website to be able to message a counsellor anytime without using your email address and can Chat 1:1 with an online advisor

  • The Mix are the UK's leading support service for young people under 25. You can talk to The Mix for free on the phone, by email or on their webchat.
      Call: 0808 808 4994 (Available Daily 1:00pm-11:00pm)
      You can also use their phone counselling service or get more information on support services you might need
surveyText.QID1364_QuestionText:
We hope you find one or more of the above helpful. 

If you would like further advice on these issues from the ECoWeB team, you can contact us. We note that the ECoWeB researchers we are not clinicians and cannot provide therapy. However, we can guide you in accessing help, for example, by contacting your GP, which is why we ask for GP details. The ECoWeB team are only available during normal working hours, Monday to Friday and may take 1 or 2 working days to respond.


The quickest thing to do is to send an email to ecoweb@exeter.ac.uk including your and your GP's contact details. 


Alternatively you can fill in the form below, but we will not receive this data until you have completed the survey
surveyText.QID754_QuestionText:
Here are some questions to see how good you are at understanding and recognising emotions. 

This will help us to measure your emotional fitness and levels of stress and well-being. By repeating these again during the next year, we can see how your emotional fitness has changed and learn what emotional fitness skills are most important for mental health and well-being in young adults.
surveyText.QID162_QuestionText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
surveyText.QID162_Choice1: 1. Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
surveyText.QID162_Choice8: 2. Not being able to stop or control worrying
surveyText.QID162_Choice9: 3. Worrying too much about different things
surveyText.QID162_Choice11: 5. Being so restless that it’s hard to sit still
surveyText.QID162_Choice13: 7. Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen
surveyText.QID139_QuestionText:
Some times people have difficulty with certain day-to-day tasks. 


 Please look at each section and determine on the scale provided how much difficulty you have carrying out each activity.
surveyText.QID148_QuestionText: 5. How difficult are FAMILY AND RELATIONSHIPS?– Form and maintain close relationships with others including the people that I live with.
surveyText.QID1230_QuestionText: Under each heading, please click the ONE box that best describes your health TODAY.
surveyText.QID150_Choice1: I have no problems in walking about
surveyText.QID150_Choice6: I have some problems in walking about
surveyText.QID151_Choice1: I have no problems with self-care
surveyText.QID151_Choice6: I have some problems washing or dressing myself
surveyText.QID151_Choice7: I am unable to wash or dress myself
surveyText.QID152_QuestionText: Usual Activities eg. work, study, housework, family or leisure activities)
surveyText.QID152_Choice1: I have no problems with perfoming my usual activities
surveyText.QID152_Choice6: I have some problems with performing my usual activities
surveyText.QID152_Choice7: I am unable to perform my usual activities
surveyText.QID153_Choice1: I have no pain or discomfort
surveyText.QID153_Choice6: I have moderate pain or discomfort
surveyText.QID153_Choice7: I have extreme pain or discomfort
surveyText.QID154_Choice1: I am not anxious or depressed
surveyText.QID154_Choice6: I am moderately anxious or depressed
surveyText.QID154_Choice7: I am extremely anxious or depressed
surveyText.QID1231_QuestionText:
© EuroQol Research Foundation. 
EQ-5D ™ is a trade mark of the EuroQol Research Foundation.
surveyText.QID155_QuestionText:
We would like to know how good or bad your health is TODAY.

This scale is numbered from 0 to 100.

100 means the best health you can imagine.
0 means the worst health you can imagine.

Please enter a number in the box below to indicate how your health is TODAY.
surveyText.QID1300_QuestionText:
We willen graag weten hoe goed of hoe slecht jouw gezondheidstoestand VANDAAG is. 
 
Deze meetschaal is genummerd van 0 tot 100. 
 
 100 betekent de beste gezondheidstoestand die je je kan voorstellen. 
0 betekent de slechtste gezondheidstoestand die je je kan voorstellen. 
 
Voer een nummer in het onderstaande vak in om aan te geven hoe uw gezondheid VANDAAG is.
surveyText.QID1299_QuestionText:
Nos gustaría saber qué tan buena o mala es su salud HOY. 
 
 Esta escala está numerada del 0 al 100. 
 
100 significa el mejor estado de salud que puedas imaginar. 
0 significa el peor estado de salud que puedas imaginar. 
 
Ingrese un número en el cuadro a continuación para indicar cómo se encuentra su salud HOY.
surveyText.QID1298_QuestionText:
Wir möchten gerne wissen, wie gut oder schlecht deine Gesundheit HEUTE ist. 


Diese Skala ist von 0 bis 100 nummeriert. 


100 bedeutet die beste Gesundheit, die du dir vorstellen kannst. 

0 bedeutet die schlechteste Gesundheit, die du dir vorstellen kannst. 


Bitte geben Sie eine Zahl in das Feld unten ein, um anzugeben, wie Ihre Gesundheit HEUTE ist.
surveyText.QID1232_QuestionText:
© EuroQol Research Foundation. 
EQ-5D ™ is a trade mark of the EuroQol Research Foundation.
surveyText.QID1336_QuestionText: Now some question about your physical health and about services you may have used in the past three months
surveyText.QID1337_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, have you attended any GP, doctor or other medical appointment?
surveyText.QID1338_QuestionText: Please answer the questions as accurately as possible for the last 3 months. If you cannot remember the exact numbers for each item, please give your best estimate.
surveyText.QID1338_Choice1: How many times have you seen a doctor at a doctor’s surgery/clinic or at your home, or spoken to a doctor by telephone?
surveyText.QID1338_Choice2: How many times have you seen a nurse at a doctor’s surgery/clinic, at your home, or in any other location in the community? This may include doctor’s surgery/clinic nurses, health visitors, district nurses, midwives etc.
surveyText.QID1338_Choice3: How many times have you seen a psychiatrist at your home or in the community? Please exclude contacts that took place in a hospital.
surveyText.QID1338_Choice4: How many times have you seen any other therapist for mental health support? This may include counselling, psychotherapy, Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT), Dialectical Behaviour Therapy (DBT), Cognitive Analytic Therapy (CAT), etc.
surveyText.QID1339_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, have you had any hospital visits, appointments or overnight stays in hospital?
surveyText.QID1340_QuestionText: Please answer the questions as accurately as possible for the last 3 months. If you cannot remember the exact numbers for each item, please give your best estimate.
surveyText.QID1340_Choice1: How many nights have you stayed in hospital overnight for a mental health difficulty?
surveyText.QID1340_Choice2: How many nights have you stayed in hospital overnight for any other reason (e.g. for a physical health difficulty)?
surveyText.QID1340_Choice3: How many hospital appointments (that did not involve an overnight stay) have you had for a mental health difficulty?
surveyText.QID1340_Choice4: How many hospital appointments (that did not involve an overnight stay) have you had for any other reason (e.g. for a physical health difficulty)?
surveyText.QID1340_Choice5: How many times have you attended accident and emergency?
surveyText.QID1340_Choice6: How many times have you received care from or transportation to hospital by an ambulance?
surveyText.QID1341_QuestionText: Did any of these appointments, hospital stays, attendance at accident and emergency or treatment/transport by an ambulance result from self-harm/injury or misuse of alcohol, drugs or other substances?
surveyText.QID1341_Choice3: Yes, if you feel able, please provide details
surveyText.QID1342_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, have you taken any medication for your mental health?
surveyText.QID1343_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, how many weeks have you been prescribed any of the following for your mental health?
surveyText.QID1344_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, have you used any other health or social care services that have not been mentioned previously?
surveyText.QID1345_QuestionText: Please describe the other health or social care services you have used and the number of contacts?
surveyText.QID1346_QuestionText: If you have been studying/working in the last 3 months, have you taken any days off as a result of your mental health?
surveyText.QID1347_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, how many days have you taken off as a result of your mental health?
surveyText.QID1348_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, have you suffered from any physical medical problems which require treatment or affect your daily life?
surveyText.QID320_QuestionText: Have there been any significant life changes for you in the last 3 months (e.g., changing/leaving school, leaving home, starting full-time work, start or end of a major relationship)?
surveyText.QID322_QuestionText: How was your experience of this change?
surveyText.QID323_QuestionText: Over the last few months, have you had a relatively major bad experience concerning your academic studies or employment – for example, getting a bad grade on an important test or paper or difficulties at work?
surveyText.QID323_Choice2: yes this happened to me ONCE during this period.
surveyText.QID323_Choice3: yes this has happened to me TWICE during this period.
surveyText.QID323_Choice4: yes this has happened to me MORE than TWICE.
surveyText.QID326_QuestionText: Over the last few months, have you had a relatively major bad experience with regard to a relationship – for example, breaking up with someone or having a big fight with your parents?
surveyText.QID326_Choice2: yes this happened to me ONCE during this period.
surveyText.QID326_Choice3: yes this has happened to me TWICE during this period.
surveyText.QID326_Choice4: yes this has happened to me MORE than TWICE.
surveyText.QID327_QuestionText: In the last few months, have you had a relatively major bad experience in some aspect of your life other than these two (e.g., someone close to you dying; losing a job; serious illness or injury to yourself or someone close to you)?
surveyText.QID327_Choice2: yes this happened to me ONCE during this period.
surveyText.QID327_Choice3: yes this has happened to me TWICE during this period.
surveyText.QID327_Choice4: yes this has happened to me MORE than TWICE.
surveyText.QID328_QuestionText:
Even if you have not had a major bad experience in any aspect of your life over the past few months, you may have experienced a certain number of minor problems or hassles.


Which of the following most accurately describes your experiences over the past few months?
surveyText.QID328_Choice4: a moderate number of minor problems and hassles
surveyText.QID328_Choice5: a very large number of minor problems and hassles
surveyText.QID925_QuestionText: Now we have some questions which ask about any periods of sadness and depression that you may have had in the last 3 months
surveyText.QID926_QuestionText: Have you in the last 3 months had a period of at least two weeks when you felt sad, empty or depressed?
surveyText.QID927_QuestionText: For the next question, think about the period of two weeks in your life when these feelings were at their worst. During this period of two weeks, how often did you feel this way?
surveyText.QID927_Choice1: Almost every day, most of the day
surveyText.QID928_QuestionText: In the last 3 months, have you had a period of at least two weeks during which you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure?
surveyText.QID929_QuestionText: For the next question, think about the period of two weeks in your life when your loss of interest was at its worst. During this period of two weeks, how often did you feel this way?
surveyText.QID929_Choice1: Almost every day, most of the day
surveyText.QID930_QuestionText: During this period in which you felt sad, empty or depressed, did you have a period of at least two weeks when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure?
surveyText.QID931_QuestionText: For the next question, think about the period of two weeks in your life when your loss of interest was at its worst. During this period of two weeks, how often did you feel this way?
surveyText.QID931_Choice1: Almost every day, most of the day
surveyText.QID932_QuestionText: People who have periods in which they feel sad, empty or depressed or experience a loss of interest, often have other problems at the same time. During this period of at least two weeks when you felt sad, empty or depressed or lose interest in things:
surveyText.QID933_QuestionText: ...did you lack energy or feel tired more than usual?
surveyText.QID934_QuestionText: ...did you have less appetite than usual, almost every day?
surveyText.QID935_QuestionText: ... did you lose weight without trying to, as much as a kilo a week during several weeks?
surveyText.QID936_QuestionText: About how much weight did you lose in kg these weeks?
surveyText.QID937_QuestionText: During this period of at least two weeks when you felt sad, empty or depressed or experienced a loss of interest in things:
surveyText.QID1004_QuestionText: ...did you have a much larger appetite than usual, and this almost every day for at least two weeks?
surveyText.QID1004_Choice5: Yes, only because of pregnancy or a growth spurt
surveyText.QID938_QuestionText: …did your appetite increase so much that you gained weight, as much as a kilo a week during several weeks?
surveyText.QID939_QuestionText: About how much weight in kg did you gain in these weeks?
surveyText.QID940_QuestionText: During this period of at least two weeks when you felt sad, empty or depressed or experienced a loss of interest in things:
surveyText.QID941_QuestionText: …. did you have trouble sleeping almost every night, either trouble falling asleep, waking in the middle of the night, or waking up too early?
surveyText.QID942_QuestionText: …. did you wake up at least two hours before you wanted to, every day for at least two weeks?
surveyText.QID943_QuestionText: …. were you sleeping too much almost every day?
surveyText.QID944_QuestionText: During this period of at least two weeks when you felt sad, empty or depressed or experienced a loss of interest in things:
surveyText.QID945_QuestionText: ...did you talk or move more slowly than is normal for you almost every day, and did other people notice this?
surveyText.QID945_Choice1: Yes, I talked or moved more slowly and other people noticed
surveyText.QID945_Choice2: Yes, I talked or moved more slowly but other people did not notice
surveyText.QID946_QuestionText: ...did you have to be moving all the time, that is, you couldn't sit still and paced up and down or couldn't keep your hands still when sitting, and did other people notice this?
surveyText.QID946_Choice1: Yes, I had to be moving all the time and other people noticed
surveyText.QID946_Choice2: Yes, I had to be moving all the time but other people did not notice
surveyText.QID947_QuestionText: During this period, did you have a lot more trouble concentrating than usual?
surveyText.QID948_QuestionText: During this period, were you unable to make up your mind about things you ordinarily had no trouble deciding about?
surveyText.QID949_QuestionText: People sometimes feel down on themselves, no good, or worthless. During this period of two weeks, did you feel guilty or worthless?
surveyText.QID950_QuestionText: During this period of two weeks, did you think a lot about death- either your own, someone else's, or death in general?
surveyText.QID1188_QuestionText: For the next question, please think about the periods of at least two weeks ever in  your life when you felt sad, empty or depressed or experienced a loss of  interest in things.
surveyText.QID951_QuestionText: Did any period of at least two weeks seriously interfere with your ability to do your job, or take care of your house, family, or yourself?
surveyText.QID952_QuestionText: About how long did the longest of periods like this last in weeks? You may give an estimate.
surveyText.QID955_QuestionText: Are you experiencing a period like this at the moment?
surveyText.QID797_QuestionText: People think and do many different things when they feel sad, blue or depressed. Please read each of the items and indicate whether you almost never, sometimes, often or almost always think or do each one when you feel sad, down or depressed.
surveyText.QID102_QuestionText: Please indicate what you generally do, not what you think you should do.
surveyText.QID102_Choice1: Think “What am I doing to deserve this?“
surveyText.QID102_Choice2: Think about a recent situation, wishing it had gone better
surveyText.QID102_Choice3: Think “Why do I have problems other people don’t have?”
surveyText.QID102_Choice13: Think “Why do I always react this way?”
surveyText.QID102_Choice17: Think “Why can’t I handle things better?”
surveyText.QID1412_QuestionText: Thanks for answering those questions, we know they can be a bit repetitive!
surveyText.QID107_QuestionText:
The items that follow describe situations in which people sometimes ask things of others. For each item, imagine that you are in the situation, and then answer the questions that follow it.


a) How tense or concerned would you be in this situation, on a scale from 1 (very unconcerned) to 6 (very concerned)


b) How likely do you think are the reactions of your counterparts in the situation described, on a scale from 1 (very unlikely) to 6 (very likely)
surveyText.QID798_QuestionText: 1.  You ask your parents or another family member for a loan to help you through a difficult financial time.
surveyText.QID108_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not your family would want to help you?
surveyText.QID109_QuestionText: I would expect that they would agree to help as much as they can
surveyText.QID799_QuestionText: 2. You approach a close friend to talk after doing or saying something that seriously upset him/her
surveyText.QID110_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not your friend would want to talk to you?
surveyText.QID111_QuestionText: I would expect that he/she would want to talk with me to try to work things out
surveyText.QID800_QuestionText: 3: You ask your supervisor for help with a problem you have been having at work/school.
surveyText.QID112_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not the person would want to help you?
surveyText.QID113_QuestionText: I would expect that he/she would want to try to help me out.
surveyText.QID801_QuestionText: 4: After a bitter argument, you call or approach your significant other because you want to make up.
surveyText.QID114_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not your very significant other would want to make up with you?
surveyText.QID115_QuestionText: I would expect that he/she would be at least as eager to make up as I would be.
surveyText.QID802_QuestionText: 5. You ask your parents or other family members to come to an occasion important to you
surveyText.QID118_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not they would want to come?
surveyText.QID119_QuestionText: I would expect that they would want to come
surveyText.QID803_QuestionText: 6. At a party, you notice someone on the other side of the room that you'd like to get to know, and you approach him or her to try to start a conversation.
surveyText.QID120_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not the person would want to talk with you?
surveyText.QID121_QuestionText: I would expect that he/she would want to talk with me
surveyText.QID804_QuestionText: 7. Lately you've been noticing some distance between yourself and your significant other, and you ask him/her if there is something wrong.
surveyText.QID122_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not he/she still loves you and wants to be with you?
surveyText.QID123_QuestionText: I would expect that he/she will show sincere love and commitment to our relationship no matter what else may be going on
surveyText.QID805_QuestionText: 8. You call a friend when there is something on your mind that you feel you really need to talk about
surveyText.QID124_QuestionText: How concerned or anxious would you be over whether or not your friend would want to listen?
surveyText.QID125_QuestionText: I would expect that he/she would listen and support me.
surveyText.QID1366_QuestionText:
¿Qué tal se te da reconocer las emociones?

Es esencial que completes la prueba de una sola vez, sin ninguna interrupción.

El uso de auriculares puede ser útil para esta tarea.


Verá una serie de videos cortos en los que los actores expresan diferentes emociones mientras hablan galimatías, por lo que no podrá entender ninguna palabra.

 

Esto puede parecer un poco extraño al principio. No se preocupe por esto: están diseñados para que pueda interpretar las emociones de alguien a partir de su tono de voz y lenguaje corporal.

 

Tu tarea es seleccionar la palabra de emoción que mejor describa la emoción que el actor quería expresar. En algunos casos esto puede ser bastante difícil. Solo confíe en su intuición - las primeras suposiciones de las personas son generalmente las mejores.


Puedes ver cada video solo una vez.


Por favor, reproduce a continuación el video de ejemplo para asegurarte de que escuchas el sonido y ajusta el volumen si es necesario.
surveyText.QID1368_QuestionText:
Después de cada video, se presentan 14 palabras referidas a la emoción, organizadas en un círculo que te ayudará a seleccionar rápidamente la emoción apropiada

Seleccione la palabra de emoción que mejor describa mejor la emoción que el actor intentó expresar en este video seleccionando el círculo al lado de la palabra. El círculo se volverá verde

Solo elige una emoción.

Para cambiar su elección, haga clic en el círculo y luego vuelva a seleccionar un círculo diferente.
surveyText.QID1369_QuestionText:
Haz clic aquí para obtener más información sobre lo que queremos decir con cada emoción.
 

Orgullo 
Sentimiento de triunfo después de un éxito o un logro personal 

Enfado
Extremo disgusto causado por la acción injusta u hostil de alguien

Alegría
Sentido provocado por algo fabuloso que ocurrió inesperadamente

Irritación
Experimentar disgusto por algo o alguien mientras te mantienes todavía tranquilo

Diversión Reírse de algo muy divertido

Asco  
Repulsión causada por un objeto o entorno desagradable

Placer
Experimentar una sensación de bienestar y deleite sensual

Tristeza
Sentirse mal después de la pérdida de una persona, lugar o cosa

Alivio
Sentirse reconfortado al finalizar o resolverse una situación incómoda, desagradable o incluso peligrosa

Desesperación
Angustia por un problema de la vida sin solución, junto con una falta de voluntad para aceptar la situación

Interés
Estar fascinado o que nuestra atención esté capturada por una persona o una cosa

Miedo
Enfrentarse a un peligro inminente que amenaza nuestro bienestar físico

Sorpresa
Frente a un evento inesperado e inusual (sin connotación positiva o negativa)

Ansiedad
Miedo o preocupación por las consecuencias de una situación que podría ser desfavorable para uno mismo o para alguien cercano
surveyText.QID1370_QuestionText:
En las siguientes dos páginas hay dos videos de ejemplo para practicar el procedimiento.

Los videos ahora se iniciarán automáticamente (se demoran unos minutos en cargarse).
surveyText.QID1371_QuestionText: Ejemplo 1.
surveyText.QID1372_QuestionText:
Seleccione la palabra de emoción que mejor describa mejor la emoción que el actor intentó expresar en este video seleccionando el círculo al lado de la palabra. El círculo se volverá verde

Solo elige una emoción.

Para cambiar su elección, haga clic en el círculo y luego vuelva a seleccionar un círculo diferente.
surveyText.QID1373_QuestionText: Ejemplo 2.
surveyText.QID1374_QuestionText:
Seleccione la palabra de emoción que mejor describa mejor la emoción que el actor intentó expresar en este video seleccionando el círculo al lado de la palabra. El círculo se volverá verde

Solo elige una emoción.

Para cambiar su elección, haga clic en el círculo y luego vuelva a seleccionar un círculo diferente.
surveyText.QID1375_QuestionText:
Ese es el final de las preguntas de ejemplo.

Las instrucciones para los videos de prueba son las mismas.

¿Estás listo para comenzar la prueba?
surveyText.QID1375_Choice2: no, por favor regresame a las instrucciones
surveyText.QID1376_QuestionText:
How well can you recognize emotions? 


It is essential that you complete the test in one go, without any interruption. 


Headphones might be useful for this task.


You will see a series of short videos in which actors express different emotions while talking gibberish so you will not be able to understand any words. 


These may seem a bit odd at first. Don’t worry about this – these are designed so that you can interpret someone’s emotions from their tone of voice and body language. 


Your task is to select the emotion word which best describes the emotion the actor wanted to express. In some cases this can be quite difficult. Just trust your intuition - people's first guesses are usually the best.


You can only watch each video once. 


Please play the example video below to make sure you hear the sound and adjust the volume if necessary.
surveyText.QID1378_QuestionText:
After each video, 14 emotion words are presented, arranged in a circle that will help you to rapidly select the appropriate emotion. 

Please select the emotion word that best describes best the emotion that the actor tried to express in this video by selecting the circle next to the word. The circle will turn green.

 CHOOSE ONLY ONE EMOTION

To change your choice, click again on the circle and then re-select a different circle.
surveyText.QID1379_QuestionText:
Click here for more information on what we mean by each emotion 

 
Pride 
Feeling of triumph following a success or a personal achievement  

Anger 
Extreme displeasure caused by someone's unfair or hostile action

Joy
Feeling excited by a really positive event that occurred unexpectedly

Irritation 
Experiencing displeasure at something or someone while still remaining calm

Amusement 
Laughing at something that is very funny 

Disgust  
Revulsion caused by an unpleasant object or environment

Pleasure 
Experiencing a feeling of well-being and sensual delight

Sadness
Feeling down after the loss of a person, place, or thing 

Relief
Feeling reassured at the end or resolution of an uncomfortable, unpleasant, or even dangerous situation

Despair
Distress at a life problem with no solution, together with an unwillingness to accept the situation

 Interest 
Being fascinated or having one's attention captured by a person or a thing

Fear
Being faced with an imminent danger that threatens our physical well-being

Surprise
Being faced with an unexpected and unusual event (without positive or negative connotation)

Anxiety
Fear of or worry about the consequences of a situation that could be unfavorable for oneself/ someone close
surveyText.QID1380_QuestionText:
On the next two pages are two example videos to practice the procedure.

The videos will now start automatically (they make take a few moments to load).
surveyText.QID1381_QuestionText: Example 1
surveyText.QID1382_QuestionText:
Please select the emotion word that best describes best the emotion that the actor tried to express in this video by selecting the circle next to the word. The circle will turn green.

CHOOSE ONLY ONE EMOTION.

To change your choice, click again on the circle and then re-select a different circle.
surveyText.QID1383_QuestionText: Example 2.
surveyText.QID1384_QuestionText:
Please select the emotion word that best describes best the emotion that the actor tried to express in this video by selecting the circle next to the word. The circle will turn green.

CHOOSE ONLY ONE EMOTION.

To change your choice, click again on the circle and then re-select a different circle.
surveyText.QID1385_QuestionText:
That is the end of the example questions. 

The instructions for the test videos are the same.

Are you ready to begin the test?
surveyText.QID1385_Choice2: No, please take me back to the instructions
surveyText.QID1396_QuestionText:
Hoe goed herken je emoties? 

Het is essentieel dat je deze test in één keer doorloopt, zonder enige onderbreking. 

Een hoofdtelefoon kan nuttig zijn voor deze test.

Je zult een reeks korte video's zien waarin acteurs verschillende emoties uiten terwijl ze wartaal praten, zodat je geen woorden kunt verstaan.

 

Deze lijken in het begin misschien wat vreemd. Maak je hier geen zorgen over - deze zijn zo ontworpen dat je iemands emoties kunt interpreteren vanuit hun stem of lichaamstaal.

 

Jouw taak is om het emotiewoord te selecteren dat het beste de emotie beschrijft die de acteur wilde uitdrukken. In sommige gevallen kan dit vrij moeilijk zijn. Vertrouw gewoon op je intuïtie - de eerste gissingen van mensen zijn meestal de beste.


Je kan elke video maar één keer bekijken.

Gelieve de voorbeeldvideo onderaan af te spelen om zeker te zijn dat je geluid hoort. Pas het volume indien nodig aan.
surveyText.QID1398_QuestionText:
Na elke video worden 14 emotiewoorden getoond in de vorm van een cirkel. Dit zal je helpen om snel de gepaste emotie te selecteren:
 
Selecteer het emotiewoord dat het beste de emotie beschrijft die de acteur in deze video probeerde uit te drukken door de cirkel naast het woord te selecteren. De cirkel wordt groen

Kies slechts één emotie.

Om uw keuze te wijzigen, klikt u op de cirkel en selecteert u opnieuw een andere cirkel.
surveyText.QID1399_QuestionText:
Klik hier voor meer informatie over wat we bedoelen met elke emotie



Trots 
Gevoel van overwinning dat volgt op een succes of persoonlijke verwezenlijking   

Kwaadheid 
Extreem ongenoegen veroorzaakt door iemands oneerlijke of vijandige handeling

Blijheid
Gevoel veroorzaakt door iets fantastisch dat onverwacht gebeurde

Irritatie
Ongenoegen ervaren bij iets of iemand terwijl men er toch kalm bij blijft

Amusement 
Lachen met iets dat heel grappig is

Walging   
Afkeer veroorzaakt door een onaangenaam object of onaangename omgeving

Genot
Ervaren van een gevoel van welzijn en zintuigelijk genoegen

Verdriet
Zich neerslachtig voelen na het verlies van een persoon, plaats of ding 

Opluchting
Gerustgesteld voelen op het einde van of bij de oplossing van een oncomfortabele, onaangename of zelfs gevaarlijke situatie

Wanhoop
Tegenspoed bij een levensprobleem waar geen oplossing voor is, zonder dat men de situatie wil of kan aanvaarden

Interesse
Gefascineerd zijn of de aandacht die getrokken wordt door een persoon of zaak

Angst
Geconfronteerd worden met een naderend gevaar dat onze fysieke gezondheid bedreigt

Verrassing
Geconfronteerd worden met een onverwachte of ongewone gebeurtenis (zonder positieve of negatieve connotatie)

Ongerustheid
Angstig of bezorgd zijn over de gevolgen van een situatie die ongunstig kunnen zijn voor zichzelf of een naaste
surveyText.QID1400_QuestionText:
Op de volgende twee pagina's staan twee voorbeeldvideo's om de procedure te oefenen.

De video's worden nu automatisch gestart (het duurt even voordat ze zijn geladen).
surveyText.QID1417_QuestionText: Voorbeeld 1.
surveyText.QID1402_QuestionText:
Selecteer het emotiewoord dat het beste de emotie beschrijft die de acteur in deze video probeerde uit te drukken door de cirkel naast het woord te selecteren. De cirkel wordt groen

Kies slechts één emotie.

Om uw keuze te wijzigen, klikt u op de cirkel en selecteert u opnieuw een andere cirkel.
surveyText.QID1418_QuestionText: Vorbeld 2.
surveyText.QID1404_QuestionText:
Selecteer het emotiewoord dat het beste de emotie beschrijft die de acteur in deze video probeerde uit te drukken door de cirkel naast het woord te selecteren. De cirkel wordt groen

Kies slechts één emotie.

Om uw keuze te wijzigen, klikt u op de cirkel en selecteert u opnieuw een andere cirkel.
surveyText.QID1405_QuestionText:
Dat is het einde van de voorbeeldvragen.

De instructies voor testvideo's zijn hetzelfde.

Ben je klaar om met de test te beginnen?
surveyText.QID1405_Choice1: Ja, ga door met de test
surveyText.QID1405_Choice2: Nee, breng me alsjeblieft terug naar de instructies
surveyText.QID1386_QuestionText:
Wie gut kannst du Emotionen erkennen?

Es ist wichtig, dass du die Aufgabe in einem Durchlauf und ohne Unterbrechungen durchführst.

Kopfhörer könnten für diese Aufgabe nützlich sein.


Sie werden eine Reihe von kurzen Videos sehen, in denen Schauspieler unterschiedliche Emotionen ausdrücken, während sie Kauderwelsch reden, sodass Sie keine Worte verstehen können.

 

Diese scheinen auf den ersten Blick etwas seltsam. Machen Sie sich darüber keine Sorgen - diese sind so konzipiert, dass Sie die Emotionen einer Person anhand ihrer Stimme und Körpersprache interpretieren können.

 

Ihre Aufgabe ist es, das Emotionswort auszuwählen, das die Emotion, die der Schauspieler ausdrücken wollte, am besten beschreibt. In einigen Fällen kann dies sehr schwierig sein. Vertrauen Sie einfach Ihrer Intuition - die ersten Vermutungen der Leute sind normalerweise die besten.


Du kannst jedes Video nur ein Mal anschauen.


Bitte spiele das Beispielvideo unten ab um sicher zu gehen, dass du den Ton hörst und du ggf. die Lautstärke anpassen kannst.
surveyText.QID1388_QuestionText:
Nach jedem Video erscheinen 14 Emotionen angeordnet in einem Kreis, der es dir ermöglicht, schnell die passende Emotion auszuwählen:

Bitte wähle die Emotion aus, die am besten die vom Schaupieler dargestellte Emotion wiedergibt, in dem du auf den Kreis neben der Emotion klickst. Der Kreis wird grün

Wähle nur 1 Emotion.

Um Ihre Auswahl zu ändern, klicken Sie auf den Kreis und wählen Sie einen anderen Kreis erneut aus.
surveyText.QID1389_QuestionText:
Klicke hier für mehr Informationen darüber, was wir mit jeder Emotion meinen.

 
Stolz 
Triumphgefühl nach einem Erfolg oder einer persönlichen Leistung  

Wut
extremer Unmut, verursacht durch unfaires oder feindseliges Verhalten einer anderen Person

Freude
Glücksgefühl nach einem unerwarteten, großartigen Ereignis

Gereiztheit
Verärgerung oder Missfallen wegen einer Person oder Sache verspüren, ohne die Beherrschung zu verlieren

Belustigung
über etwas sehr Witziges lachen

Ekel   
Abscheu, verursacht durch ein unangenehmes Objekt oder eine unangenehme Umgebung

Geniessen
Gefühl von Wohlbehagen und sinnlichem Vergnügen

Traurigkeit
Niedergeschlagenheit nach dem Verlust einer Sache oder einer Person

Erleichterung
Beruhigung nach der Lösung bzw. dem Ende einer unangenehmen oder sogar gefährlichen Situation

Verzweiflung
Leid angesichts eines persönlichen Problems ohne Lösung und gleichzeitiges Sträuben dagegen, dies zu akzeptieren

Interesse
Faszination und Aufmerksamkeit in Bezug auf eine Sache oder eine Person

Panische Angst
vor einer unmittelbaren Gefahr, die unser körperliches Wohlbefinden gefährdet.

Überraschende
Begegnung mit einem unerwarteten und ungewöhnlichen Ereignis (ohne positive oder negative Konnotation)

Beunruhigung
Ängstlichkeit oder Besorgnis über die Konsequenzen einer ungünstigen Situation für sich selbst oder eine nahestehende Person
surveyText.QID1390_QuestionText:
Hier sind zwei Beispielvideos, um das Verfahren zu üben und ggf. die Lautstärke anzupassen.

Die Videos werden nun automatisch gestartet (es dauert einige Momente, bis sie geladen sind).

Um Ihre Auswahl zu ändern, klicken Sie auf den Kreis und wählen Sie einen anderen Kreis erneut aus.

Bitte wähle die Emotion aus, die am besten die vom Schaupieler dargestellte Emotion wiedergibt, in dem du auf den Kreis neben der Emotion klickst. Der Kreis wird grün

Wähle nur 1 Emotion.

Um Ihre Auswahl zu ändern, klicken Sie auf den Kreis und wählen Sie einen anderen Kreis erneut aus.

Bist du bereit mit dem Test zu beginnen?

surveyText.QID1407_QuestionText:
Please select the emotion word that best describes best the emotion that the actor tried to express in this video by selecting the circle next to the word.

CHOOSE ONLY ONE EMOTION

 To change your choice, click again on the circle and then re-select a different circle.
surveyText.QID1408_QuestionText:
Seleccione la palabra de emoción que mejor describa mejor la emoción que el actor intentó expresar en este video seleccionando el círculo al lado de la palabra.

Solo elige una emoción.

Para cambiar su elección, haga clic en el círculo y luego vuelva a seleccionar un círculo diferente.
surveyText.QID1409_QuestionText:
Selecteer het emotiewoord dat het beste de emotie beschrijft die de acteur in deze video probeerde uit te drukken door de cirkel naast het woord te selecteren.

Kies slechts één emotie.

Om uw keuze te wijzigen, klikt u op de cirkel en selecteert u opnieuw een andere cirkel.
surveyText.QID1410_QuestionText:
Bitte wähle die Emotion aus, die am besten die vom Schaupieler dargestellte Emotion wiedergibt, in dem du auf den Kreis neben der Emotion klickst.

Wähle nur 1 Emotion.

Um Ihre Auswahl zu ändern, klicken Sie auf den Kreis und wählen Sie einen anderen Kreis erneut aus.
surveyText.QID1413_QuestionText: Thanks for watching those, now some more questionnaires.
surveyText.QID103_QuestionText: Select the answer that best describes how typical or characteristic each item is of you.
surveyText.QID103_Choice2: I know I should not worry about things but I just cannot help it.
surveyText.QID103_Choice3: When I am under pressure I worry a lot.
surveyText.QID103_Choice4: I have been a worrier all my life.
surveyText.QID103_Choice5: I notice that I have been worrying about things.
surveyText.QID103_Choice17: I am always worrying about something.
surveyText.QID103_Choice18: As soon as I finish one task, I start to worry about everything else I have to do.
surveyText.QID252_QuestionText:
​Understanding emotional experiences ​


This questionnaire assesses your understanding of emotional experiences. This test looks at your understanding of five basic aspects of the emotion process:

  1. Event appraisal: refers to the way the person evaluates or interprets the event that causes the emotion.  

  2. Bodily reaction: refers to how the body reacts during the emotion.  

  3. Expression: refers to how the emotion is expressed to others in the face, the voice, or the bodily posture.  

  4. Action tendency: refers to the tendency to behave in certain ways during the emotion.  

  5. Subjective feeling: refers to the feeling that characterizes the emotion.  

In this test six emotional events are described that persons have experienced in the past. For each event four possible emotional reactions are presented. Please indicate for each reaction how likely it is that the person would have this emotional reaction in this situation. Please use the following response scale: 

 

  1. Very unlikely

  2. Unlikely

  3. Neither likely, nor unlikely

  4. Likely

  5. Very likely
surveyText.QID836_QuestionText:
Event 1.


Oliver is invited to a friend’s birthday party at the student residence. After arriving at the venue, and looking at the decorations, he realizes that the party is actually organized for him by his friends. How likely would the following reactions be for Oliver at that moment?
surveyText.QID255_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following EMOTION? 

Disappointment
surveyText.QID846_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following SUBJECTIVE FEELING? 

He feels tired
surveyText.QID848_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following BODILY REACTION?

He feels cold
surveyText.QID849_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following ACTION TENDENCY response? 

He wants to destroy whatever is close.
surveyText.QID837_QuestionText:
Event 2.


 Alex is the first one to be accepted at university in her family. Her family pooled all their resources together to finance her studies. Upon arriving at the university, she enjoyed the student life and did not work very hard. At the end of the first year, she fails most of her modules. How likely would the following reactions be for Alex at that moment?
surveyText.QID850_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following EMOTION? 

Guilt.
surveyText.QID851_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following SUBJECTIVE FEELING? 

She feels bad.
surveyText.QID852_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she EXPRESSES her emotion in the following way? 

 She speaks in a firm voice.
surveyText.QID853_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following ACTION TENDENCY? 

She wants to make up for what she has done.
surveyText.QID838_QuestionText:
Event 3.


Chris experienced the master’s program as challenging. At the end of the academic year he receives his final results. He completed his master degree with high merits. How likely would each of the following reactions be for Chris at that moment?
surveyText.QID854_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following EMOTION? 

Disappointment
surveyText.QID855_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following EVENT APPRAISAL?

He thinks: 'This is an unpleasant situation for me'
surveyText.QID856_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following SUBJECTIVE FEELING? 

He feels positive
surveyText.QID857_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following BODILY REACTION? 

He feels warm
surveyText.QID839_QuestionText:
Event 4.


Harry receives the results of the semester test. He finds out that some correct answers have been marked wrong. Harry then asks the lecturer to rectify this and change the marks, but the lecturer refuses. How likely would the following reactions be for Harry at that moment?
surveyText.QID858_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following EVENT APPRAISAL? 

He thinks: 'I am treated unjustly.'
surveyText.QID859_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following SUBJECTIVE FEELINGS?

He feels calm
surveyText.QID861_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he EXPRESSES his emotion in the following way? 

He frowns
surveyText.QID862_QuestionText:
How likely is it that he has the following ACTION TENDENCY? 

He wants to oppose.
surveyText.QID840_QuestionText:
Event 5.


Sarah has a special relationship with her uncle. The uncle regards Sarah as his child, since he does not have children of his own. One morning while at the university, Sarah receives a call from home saying that her uncle has suddenly passed away. How likely would the following reactions be for Sarah at that moment?
surveyText.QID863_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following EVENT APPRAISAL? 

She thinks: 'The consequences of this situation are positive, desirable for me.'
surveyText.QID865_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following BODILY REACTION? 

She feels a lump in her throat.
surveyText.QID866_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she EXPRESSES her emotion in the following way? 

She has tears in her eyes.
surveyText.QID867_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following ACTION TENDENCY? 

She wants the ongoing situation to last or be repeated.
surveyText.QID841_QuestionText:
Event 6.


Tess was recently attacked during the evening when walking back home from the university library. A few days later she receives an invitation from a good friend to attend an important reunion organized near the place where the attack happened. How likely would the following reactions be for Tess at the moment when she receives that invitation?
surveyText.QID868_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following EMOTION? 

Fear
surveyText.QID869_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following EVENT APPRAISAL? 

She thinks: 'This situation is unpleasant for me.'
surveyText.QID870_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she has the following BODILY REACTION?

Her muscles are relaxing.
surveyText.QID871_QuestionText:
How likely is it that she EXPRESSES her emotion in the following way?

She smiles.
surveyText.QID89_QuestionText:
We would now like to ask you some more questions about your educational background.


Which currently best describes your education? Are you...
surveyText.QID89_Choice3: working including caring for dependents (e.g.children) full-time
surveyText.QID89_Choice4: a former student who has left/ completed secondary school and is not working or studying (yet)
surveyText.QID89_Choice5: a former student who has left/ completed university or higher education technical college and is not working yet
surveyText.QID1411_QuestionText: How successful do you feel you are at present at school, university, or on your job?
surveyText.QID566_QuestionText:
What on average are your most recent term or exam grades? 


Please use the slider to indicate your average percentage marks.
surveyText.QID567_QuestionText:
What were your most recent end-term or exam grades for your main (principal) subject?


If you are studying several subjects, usually Maths or English
surveyText.QID569_QuestionText: Please select your highest level of COMPLETED education:
surveyText.QID569_Choice14: 3. upper secondary school/sixth form college, e.g. A levels
surveyText.QID569_Choice15: 4. higher education not at university (e.g., technical college)
surveyText.QID756_QuestionText:
On the next page are some questions about the work you do and how you feel about it, whether that is at school, university, or when employed. 

If you are not employed, attending school, or studying at the moment then please answer the questions about the last job or course you did or the last school you attended.
surveyText.QID63_QuestionText:
Part 1 - ACHIEVEMENT APPRAISALS

The following items relate to your tasks and your personal experiences at school, and to your beliefs about intelligence. There are no right or wrong answers, so please be candid in your responses. 

Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
surveyText.QID64_Choice1: I have a great deal of control over my performance at school.
surveyText.QID64_Choice2: The more effort I put into my classes, the better I do in them.
surveyText.QID64_Choice3: No matter what I do, I can’t seem to do well in my classes.
surveyText.QID64_Choice8: My grades in my classes are basically determined by things beyond my control and there is little I can do to change that.
surveyText.QID68_Choice3: No matter who you are, you can significantly change your intelligence level.
surveyText.QID68_Choice5: You can always substantially change how intelligent you are.
surveyText.QID69_QuestionText: C. Beliefs about the Value of Achievement
surveyText.QID69_Choice1: In general, I find my classes at school very interesting.
surveyText.QID69_Choice3: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I am interested in the subject matter of my classes regardless of the grades I get.
surveyText.QID69_Choice4: In general, learning about the contents of my classes is useful for me.
surveyText.QID69_Choice6: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">Learning more about the materials in my classes is useful for my future.
surveyText.QID1309_Choice7: Being good in my classes is very important to me.
surveyText.QID1309_Choice8: Compared to my other activities, it is very important to me to perform well in my classes.
surveyText.QID1309_Choice11: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">Compared to my other activities, it is very important to me to avoid performing poorly in my classes.
surveyText.QID1309_Choice12: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">It is very bad for me when I get poor grades in my classes.
surveyText.QID70_QuestionText:
Part 2 - EMOTIONS AT SCHOOL

Attending classes, studying, and taking tests and exams at school can induce different feelings. This part of the questionnaire is about the feelings you may experience at school. There are 12 items that are organized into two sections. 


We are interested in your personal opinions. There are no right or wrong answers, so please be candid in your responses. 


Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
surveyText.QID72_QuestionText:
A. Before starting to work. 

 

This part of the questionnaire refers to emotions you may experience BEFORE being in class, studying, or taking a test at school. Prior to answering the questions on the following pages, please recall some typical situations of attending class, studying, or taking a test you have experienced at school during the past few months. Please read each item carefully and indicate how you typically feel before attending class, studying, or taking a test.
surveyText.QID72_Choice1: I get excited about doing my work.
surveyText.QID72_Choice3: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I get tense when I start to work.
surveyText.QID74_QuestionText:
B. During work

 

The following questions pertain to feelings you may experience DURING class, studying, or taking a test.  Please indicate how you typically feel during class, studying, or taking a test.
surveyText.QID74_Choice2: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I enjoy the challenges in my classes.
surveyText.QID74_Choice6: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I feel nervous during difficult tasks.
surveyText.QID74_Choice9: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I worry that I might fail.
surveyText.QID74_Choice14: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">My assignments are so boring that I find myself daydreaming.
surveyText.QID74_Choice15: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I get so bored, I have problems staying alert.
surveyText.QID74_Choice22: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I feel so hopeless that I have no energy left.
surveyText.QID75_QuestionText:
Part 1 - ACHIEVEMENT APPRAISALS

  

The following items relate to your tasks and your personal experiences at university, and to your beliefs about intelligence. There are no right or wrong answers, so please be candid in your responses. 

Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
surveyText.QID76_Choice1: I have a great deal of control over my performance at university.
surveyText.QID76_Choice2: The more effort I put into my modules, the better I do in them.
surveyText.QID76_Choice3: No matter what I do, I can’t seem to do well in my modules.
surveyText.QID76_Choice8: My grades in my modules are basically determined by things beyond my control and there is little I can do to change that.
surveyText.QID77_Choice3: No matter who you are, you can significantly change your intelligence level.
surveyText.QID77_Choice5: You can always substantially change how intelligent you are.
surveyText.QID78_QuestionText: C. Beliefs about the Value of Achievement
surveyText.QID78_Choice1: In general, I find my modules at university very interesting.
surveyText.QID78_Choice3: I am interested in the subject matter of my modules regardless of the grades I get.
surveyText.QID78_Choice4: In general, learning about the contents of my modules is useful for me.
surveyText.QID78_Choice6: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">Learning more about the materials in my modules is useful for my future.
surveyText.QID1310_Choice7: Being good in my modules is very important to me.
surveyText.QID1310_Choice8: Compared to my other activities, it is very important to me to perform well in my modules.
surveyText.QID1310_Choice12: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">It is very bad for me when I get poor grades in my modules.
surveyText.QID1310_Choice16: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">Compared to my other activities, it is very important to me to avoid performing poorly in my courses
surveyText.QID79_QuestionText:
Part 2 - EMOTIONS AT UNIVERSITY


Attending classes, studying, and taking tests and exams at university can induce different feelings. This part of the questionnaire is about the feelings you may experience at university. There are 12 items that are organized into two sections.

We are interested in your personal opinions. There are no right or wrong answers, so please be candid in your responses. 

Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
surveyText.QID80_QuestionText:
A. Before starting to work. 

 

This part of the questionnaire refers to emotions you may experience BEFORE being in class, studying, or taking a test at university. Prior to answering the questions on the following pages, please recall some typical situations of attending class, studying, or taking a test you have experienced at university during the past few months. 

 

Please read each item carefully and indicate how you typically feel before attending class, studying, or taking a test.
surveyText.QID80_Choice1: I get excited about doing my work.
surveyText.QID80_Choice3: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I get tense when I start to work.
surveyText.QID81_QuestionText:
B. During work

 

The following questions pertain to feelings you may experience DURING class, studying, or taking a test. 

 

 Please indicate how you typically feel during class, studying, or taking a test.
surveyText.QID81_Choice2: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I enjoy the challenges in my modules.
surveyText.QID81_Choice6: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I feel nervous during difficult tasks.
surveyText.QID81_Choice9: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I worry that I might fail.
surveyText.QID81_Choice14: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">My assignments are so boring that I find myself daydreaming.
surveyText.QID81_Choice15: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I get so bored, I have problems staying alert.
surveyText.QID81_Choice22: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I feel so hopeless that I have no energy left.
surveyText.QID82_QuestionText:
Part 1 - ACHIEVEMENT APPRAISALS

 

The following items relate to your tasks and your personal experiences at your job, and to your beliefs about intelligence. There are no right or wrong answers, so please be candid in your responses. 

Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
surveyText.QID83_Choice1: I have a great deal of control over my performance in my work.
surveyText.QID83_Choice2: The more effort I put into my work, the better I do in them.
surveyText.QID83_Choice3: No matter what I do, I can’t seem to do well in my work.
surveyText.QID83_Choice8: The evaluations I get for my work are basically determined by things beyond my control and there is little I can do to change that.
surveyText.QID84_Choice3: No matter who you are, you can significantly change your intelligence level.
surveyText.QID84_Choice5: You can always substantially change how intelligent you are.
surveyText.QID85_QuestionText: C. Beliefs about the Value of Achievement
surveyText.QID85_Choice1: In general, I find my work very interesting.
surveyText.QID85_Choice3: I am interested in my work, regardless of the paycheck
surveyText.QID85_Choice5: Compared to my other activities, doing my work is very useful for me.
surveyText.QID85_Choice6: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">Doing my work is useful for my future.
surveyText.QID1311_Choice7: Being good at my work is very important to me.
surveyText.QID1311_Choice8: Compared to my other activities, it is very important to me to perform well in my work.
surveyText.QID1311_Choice11: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">Compared to my other activities, it is very important to me to avoid performing poorly in my work.
surveyText.QID1311_Choice12: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">It is very bad for me when I get poor evaluations for my work.
surveyText.QID86_QuestionText:
Part 2 - EMOTIONS AT WORK
 

Completing the assignments on one's job can induce different feelings. This part of the questionnaire is about the feelings you may experience related to your job. There are 12 items that are organized into two sections. 


We are interested in your personal opinions. There are no right or wrong answers, so please be candid in your responses. 

 

Please indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with each of the following statements.
surveyText.QID87_QuestionText:
A. Before starting to work. 

 

This part of the questionnaire refers to emotions you may experience BEFORE starting to work. Prior to answering the questions on the following pages, please recall some typical situations of working on your tasks you have experienced during the past few months. Please indicate how you typically feel before starting work assignments.
surveyText.QID87_Choice1: I get excited about doing my work.
surveyText.QID87_Choice3: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I get tense when I start to work.
surveyText.QID88_QuestionText:
B. During work

 

The following questions pertain to feelings you may experience DURING working on the tasks of your job. Please indicate how you typically feel during work assignments.
surveyText.QID88_Choice2: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I enjoy the challenges in my work.
surveyText.QID88_Choice6: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I feel nervous during difficult tasks.
surveyText.QID88_Choice9: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I worry that I might fail.
surveyText.QID88_Choice14: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">My assignments are so boring that I find myself daydreaming.
surveyText.QID88_Choice15: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I get so bored, I have problems staying alert.
surveyText.QID88_Choice22: <span style="font-size:13px;"><span style="font-family:verdana,geneva,sans-serif;">I feel so hopeless that I have no energy left.
surveyText.QID1307_QuestionText:
EMODIS - Emotional Reactions

We will present you with four emotion situations

 

Please imagine vividly that you are in each  situation described and respond as if you had actually experienced the situation.

Please move the slider in the direction that best describes your reaction.
surveyText.QID1010_QuestionText:
You have trouble getting up in the morning and thus you are frequently late for work/school. Today you were pretty late again. Your boss/teacher passed you in the hall and tells you he wants to see you later.

The event is...
surveyText.QID1014_Label1: difficult for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1014_Label3: easy for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1312_QuestionText: How intensely would you experience each of the following emotions?
surveyText.QID1019_QuestionText:
Your relationship with your boyfriend/girlfriend has been troubled lately. Your feelings toward your partner are no longer as warm as they used to be. You are wondering whether it might not be better to end the relationship.

The event is...
surveyText.QID1022_Label1: difficult for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1022_Label3: easy for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1025_QuestionText: How intensely would you experience each of the following emotions?
surveyText.QID1028_QuestionText:
During a party at your place, you happen to overhear two of your friends say some rather unpleasant things about you.

The event is...
surveyText.QID1031_Label1: difficult for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1031_Label3: easy for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1034_QuestionText: How intensely would you experience each of the following emotions?
surveyText.QID1036_QuestionText:
You have been suspecting for some time that your boyfriend/girlfriend might not be completely faithful to you. And now you have just heard from an old acquaintance that he has seen your girlfriend/boyfriend holding hands with someone else.

The event is...
surveyText.QID1039_Label1: difficult for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1039_Label3: easy for me to deal with
surveyText.QID1042_QuestionText: How intensely would you experience each of the following emotions?
surveyText.QID1351_QuestionText: Finally we have some questions asking for feedback about your experience so far with the app and study as a whole.
surveyText.QID1352_QuestionText: Have you had any problems with the app?
surveyText.QID1353_QuestionText: Has any aspect of the app or study made you feel worse?
surveyText.QID1354_QuestionText: What have been the positives of using the app?
surveyText.QID1355_QuestionText: Do you have any thoughts or comments you'd like to share about your experience with this survey?
surveyText.QID1414_QuestionText: Thank you for completing the ECoWeB 3 month follow up assessment
surveyText.QID1358_QuestionText: Please press 'continue' to send us your response
